channel.title: Piezo trigger question?
channel.description:
my piezo and push sensor experiment feels very good ... Now my 2 piezo disk are connected /audio in with the patch i founded in the libary very musical when connected pitch with expression pedal my question can i connect more piezo disc with axoloti ? schmitt trigger ? i am confused ... i am afraid of the spikes piezo's can produce .
The piezo disk feels good and gives it rhythm it's amazing when connected with sample/hold got a strange squeezing effect when pressed more like a teddy bear ... any ideas ?

item.title: Piezo trigger question?
item.dc:creator: @matthewcieplak Matthew Cieplak
item.description:
@matthewcieplak wrote:

I played around with getting piezo inputs to to work with my e-drum kit (and ended up going with an arduino instead). If you want to use the regular analog in pins, you'll probably want a simple input filter circuit using an op-amp to preamp and limit the peaks of the signal. @timvets mentioned he'd used some piezo disks via the regular analog pins in this thread: https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/analog-inputs-for-trigger-to-midi-capability/604
